summary: a 19-year-old man was brought to our clinic with complaints of fever, headache, fatigue, and left lower quadrant pain that had persisted for 3 weeks. encephalitis and cervical lymphadenopathies followed a benign course, as did the cervical lymph node biopsy. imoto disease should be included in differential diagnosis when a patient presents with encephalitis, testitis, and fever of unknown origin.
